instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos,

I've received looks to be a new board but hasn't been serialized. I don't have Medusa2 to play with :( and already tried blank board serializer v1.1 but it doesn't work on later boards. 
I've tried manually hexedit the dump but doesn't have the SSN entry. 
can you help me serialize with Medusa2?

this is original rom, 

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1q8SOd3dKmc4kv1wENlwPINhfMfCmdoiu/view?usp=sharing[/url]

serial on the bottom case: C02MM9C1FGYY

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: I will try to do it tomorrow, to late here now...

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: any luck? or should i just use a clean me rom and edit the sn manually?

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
Sorry, didn't work this Sunday.
If you edit SSN, you must fix checksum too.
I hope Monday I'll have time to do it.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: I just tried LBE on the file and it won't work.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="KC Micro Tronix, post: 50694"]I just tried LBE on the file and it won't work.[/QUOTE]

i guess that program is looking for ssn instance??  this dump doesn't have it.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: If you have another board with that bios I could set it's SN. I do not..  I dug though my pile.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: i can do these myself thru hedit, I just wanted to have proper fsys checksum. are you saying LBE can correct fsys checksum after editing the sn?

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
Test and comment...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=13RS2eQygHeDOZ3b9DyTHqeJppxwCRspV[/url]

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: LBE will take a bios with a SN and let you change it to what ever you want on the fly. I have used it quite a bit when replacing boards I can't fix. I have been happy with it.  My programmer has the j-tag adapter so unlike Louis I don't take them off the boards.  I use them!

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 50729"]Test and comment...
[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=13RS2eQygHeDOZ3b9DyTHqeJppxwCRspV"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=13R...THqeJppxwCRspV[/URL][/QUOTE]

i don't know why these two files are giving sensor errors on ASD EFI which causing high-speed fan. then I put back the original unmodified rom and its working fine without error but no serial.

could it be wrong SMC version?
2informaticos, Any ideas? 



[B]original unmodified rom[/B]
----------------------------------------------
[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/WIsyfsp.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
I didn't find any FGYY BIOS file.
I used G3QH series to build the file.
You can try to swap your original ME region into the files I sent to you.

I will try tomorrow to inject modified FSYS area from G3QH into your original file.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: i wasn't aware there are different series. I'll wait for you. I probably will do it incorrectly.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
Try this now.
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1QwSbXKc_VohS8FeAR8grTOxGQz4egscF[/url]

If not, see if you can find an FGYY BIOS file on Internet, to use it.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
when i do find an FGYY bios file, how can i tell if is really FGYY?

thanks

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: Search for SSN in the file and see if serial number ends with FGYY...

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
still the same.

can i just use the original, insert the serial area and call it a day?

[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/9tD47JP.png[/IMG]



i get ambient air sensor error. CPU proximity error and fin stack error when I use your files.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message: Last file is your backup with FSYS area injected.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
mm, let me put back the original one again to check if there's any sensor error. pretty certain there wasn't any.

do you reckon there is crap under the SMC and also caused original bios to become corrupted and doesn't show sensor error?

might just require a reflow or should it, original edge bonding is still present...

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
edit. .


yep, no ambient air sensor, CPU proximity and fin stack error on the original bios.

this is weird.

should i just use your last bios and give SMC a reflow? even tho i don't see any liquid on the board.

threads.title: 820-3476 - new blank serial board.
threads.message:
all your bios were good after all. this board isn't new. lying bastard to whoever sold him the board.

fixed after quick reflow on the smc.
